input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Gender has a direct effect on smoking and lung cancer. Smoking has a direct effect on tar deposit. Tar deposit has a direct effect on lung cancer. Gender is unobserved. The overall probability of smoking is 52%. The probability of nonsmoking and lung cancer is 16%. The probability of smoking and lung cancer is 26%. Is the chance of lung cancer smaller when observing smoking?
